name: Residential Address Detection
author: Eniture Technology

sections.description:
An add-on plugin developed by Eniture Technology. The plugin works with Eniture Technology’s Small Package Quotes and LTL Freight Quotes plugins. It identifies the address type of the ship-to address provided by website visitors. When the address type is residential, the residential delivery fee is included in the shipping rate estimate returned by the carrier.

Key Features

  • When enabled, automatically identifies residential and commercial addresses.

Requirements

  • WooCommerce 5.7 or newer.
  • The installation of at least one of Eniture Technology’s Small Package Quotes or LTL Freight Quotes plugins.
sections.changelog:
2.5.0

  • Update: Added feature “Do not return rates if the ship to address appears to be a post office box”

2.4.3

  • Update: Compatibility with WooCommerce HPOS(High-Performance Order Storage)

2.4.2

  • Update: Compatibility with FreightQuote version 2.2.8

2.4.1

  • Update: Updated end point URL from sub folder to sub domain

2.4.0

  • Fix: Allow space character in the city name

2.3.0

  • Update: Added feature “Address Type Disclosure”

2.2.6

  • Update: Compatibility with WordPress version 6.1
  • Update: Compatibility with WooCommerce version 7.0.1

2.2.5

  • Update: Added compatibility with plugin TQL.
  • Fix: Fixes in compatibility with plugin DAY&ROSS.

2.2.4

  • Update: Compatibility with PHP version 8.1.
  • Update: Compatibility with WordPress version 5.9.

2.2.3

  • Compatibility with GlobalTranz.

2.2.2

  • Update: Compatibility with PHP version 8.0
  • Update: Compatibility with WordPress version 5.8

2.2.1

  • Update: Added compatibility with plugin DAY&ROSS.

2.1.1

  • Compatibility with Freigtview v2 plugin

2.1.0

  • Update: Compatibility with WooCommerce 5.6

2.0.1

  • Update: Compatibility with WooCommerce 5.5.

2.0.0

  • Update: For only small package plugins
    a) Overrides the Auto-detect residential addresses functionality with the user-defined value.
    b) Default value of unconfirmed addresses.
    c) RAD in a separate tab

1.1.2

  • Update: Compatibility with WooCommerce 5.4.

1.1.1

  • Fix: UI Fixed on setting page.

1.1.0

  • Update: Introduced an option to control default address is commercial or residential.

1.0.0

  • Initial release.
sections.reviews:
Verifies Addresses But Rips You Off

By pcawilliams on July 20, 2021

I reached out to the plugin Support and after a lot of back and forth I was told that this plugin is acting as intended. The lowest paid option for this plugin is $5 per 100 Address Verifications which seems like a deal overall. Once you get to the checkout page you will be disappointed to find out that every time you update a part of the shipping address, as you update the whole thing, it triggers with each field left. 1. Change the street address - Plugin detects address 2. Change City - Plugin detects address 3. Change State - Plugin detects address 4. Change Zip Code - Plugin detects address So for every address change for purposes of getting a freight quote you are actually verifying an address 4 times, not counting the one verification that may be triggered on your cart page even without a street address. Do better, Devs. This is not the correct way for your plugin to work. Here is the response I received below.: 
Hi Anthony,

The Developer's response is pasted below, there is no issue, the behavior is as expected from woo commerce and we do not need to make any changes to the theme.
Please see if this works for you, if not, I will be glad to process full refunds on your subscriptions, if the App is unable to serve your purpose
******************************************************************
Request sending behavior showing in the customer video is working fine. Maybe, the customer is new to WordPress. When a customer is changing any field on the checkout page, always request will send. It’s woocommerce default behavior. Woocommerce has validation on the checkout page for Receiver Address, City, State, and Country. These should be filled. When any field will be changed, a new request will be sent. You can see clearly in the video that the customer is changing the address every time. So WooCommerce and plugins have triggered the requests.
***********************************************
